intro: Mitella reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf mitella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its kidney-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Mitella reniformis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
